## GANTT charts for each week

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| output: asis

from cnvsapi.build_utils import get_current_week_from_lecture_id
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

def make_week( week_id ):

    original_date_str = "1/13/2025"
    original_date = datetime.strptime(original_date_str, "%m/%d/%Y")
    new_date = original_date + timedelta(weeks=(week_id - 1) )
    new_date_str = new_date.strftime("%m/%d/%Y").lstrip("0").replace("/0", "/")

    # Define the content you want to write to the file
    content = f"""
gantt
    dateFormat  M/DD/YYYY
    axisFormat  %b %e

section Week
    Wk {week_id} : crit, {new_date_str}, 6d

section Topics
    ER Models : m1, 1/12/2025, 3w
    Rel. Algebra: m4, after m1, 2w
    Normal forms: m5, after m4, 2w
    Break: crit, m8, 3/09/2025, 1w
    SQL : m6, after m5, 5w
    Adv. SQL: m7, after m6, 24d
    Reading Day : crit, m10, 4/30/2025, 1d
    Finals : crit, m9, 5/01/2025, 5d

"""

    # Open the file in write mode ('w' will create the file if it doesn't exist or overwrite it if it does)
    with open(f"week-{week_id:02}-mermaid.mmd", "w") as file:
        file.write(content)

for i in range(1,17):
    make_week( i )

```
